did.abstract: The collection contains the papers of Ladislaus Fodor (1898-1978), a Hungarian novelist, playwright and screenwriter.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in 1991 by Hannes Parnegg, Ladislaus Fodor's stepson and executor of his estate.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Ladislaus Fodor (1898-1978) was a Hungarian novelist, playwright and screenwriter. Some of his plays include A Church Mouse, Jewel Robbery, I Love an Actress, The Kiss Before the Mirror, Youth at the Helm, and Matura.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence, play scripts, film treatments and synopses in Hungarian, German and English. The main collection of Ladislaus Fodor's papers is at the Deutsche Nationalbibliothek, Frankfurt am Main.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.
